title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg
summary: The Starlink 11-19 mission will be SpaceX’s 50th launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base in 2025. It’s targeting liftoff from pad Space Launch Complex 4 East at 10:59 a.m. PDT (1:59 p.m. EDT / 1759 UTC).

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Falcon 9 rocket on record-breaking 31st flight
summary: The Starlink 10-17 mission will add another 28 broadband satellites into low Earth orbit. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 11:49 a.m. EDT (1549 UTC).

title: France and Germany Agree to Implement ODIN’S EYE Missile Warning System
summary:
On 15 October, the Defence Ministers of Germany and France signed an agreement to jointly implement the ODIN’S EYE missile early warning system. title: Europe outlines defense flagship programs and confirms European Space Shield by 2026
summary:
Krakow — The European Commission presented a working plan to track progress and deliver key defense capabilities by 2030 to European Union member states on October 16. The roadmap, titled Preserving Peace – Defence Readiness Roadmap 2030, follows March’s White Paper for European Defence – Readiness 2030 and the broader ReArm Europe/Readiness 2030 package, which […]

title: German launch startup HyImpulse raises 45 million euros
summary:
German launch startup HyImpulse has raised 45 million euros ($53 million) as it works to avoid becoming an also-ran in the European space launch race.
The post German launch startup HyImpulse raises 45 million euros appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA astronauts complete helicopter training in preparation for future lunar missions
summary: Four ESA astronauts have completed a helicopter training course with the German Bundeswehr, Germany’s federal defence forces, marking a key milestone in Europe’s preparations for future missions to the Moon and operations on the lunar surface.

title: Money is pouring into defense but dual-use is the real sweet spot
summary:
It isn’t surprising that more and more space companies are pivoting to defense. Defense budgets are rising across the board, and rising quickly. title: First Ariane 64 launch slips to 2026
summary:
Arianespace has confirmed that the first flight of the more powerful version of the Ariane 6 rocket has been delayed until next year.
